metadata.titleEn: GEOCHRONOLOGICAL data of Muscovite from Wangu gold deposit, Northeastern Hunan Province
metadata.description:
The selection of Muscovite was completed in Hebei Chengxin Service Co., Ltd. in 2017. The samples were crushed to more than 20 mesh by conventional methods, and about 200 mg Muscovite was selected from each sample under binocular microscope. The purity of Muscovite was more than 99%. The selected samples were first sent to B4 channel of 49-2 reactor of China Academy of atomic energy for neutron irradiation. The Muscovite sample was wrapped into a 6 mm sphere with pure aluminum platinum paper, sealed in a quartz glass bottle, and wrapped with 0.5 mm thick CD skin. The irradiation time was 30 hours, and the fast neutron flux was 2.2576 × 1018。 At the same time, the pure substances CaF2 and K2SO4 were irradiated simultaneously, and the correction factors were obtained as follows: (36Ar / 37Ar) Ca = 0.000271, (39Ar / 37Ar) Ca = 0.000652, (40Ar / 39Ar) k = 0.00703. The irradiated sample is cooled, put into the sample rack, sealed and degassed, and then put into the system.
The sample dy02 was sent to the Key Laboratory of orogenic belt and crustal evolution, Peking University for AR Ar dating. The rga10 mass spectrometer was used for the test. The detailed test process is shown in hall and Farrell (1995). Five groups of Ar isotope signals were recorded by mass spectrometer, and the signal intensity unit was MV. Blank samples were measured once every three tests. The detailed method of data processing is shown in nomade et al. (2005). Samples 14jm14 and 14jm15 were sent to China University of Geosciences (Wuhan) for AR Ar dating. The instrument used in the test was Argus VI mass spectrometer. The detailed testing process is shown in Qiu et al. (2015), and the detailed data processing method is shown in Koppers (2002)
metadata.instructions: Stored in word format, the sample name is "YY DD", where YY represents the sampling location and DD represents the sample number.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the geochemical data collection methods used for white mica in mining regions?
Feature Specification.Answer: purity greater than 99%, crushed to over 20 mesh, neutron irradiation at a specific flux, Ar isotopes measured using mass spectrometers

Quantification.Question: How many white mica samples were selected for geochemical dating in the context of a dataset related to the Wangu gold mining area?

Comparison.Question: How do the data collection methods for Ar-Ar dating using the RGA10 mass spectrometer at Peking University compare to those using the Argus VI mass spectrometer at China University of Geosciences (Wuhan) in terms of sample preparation and instrument calibration?
Comparison.Answer: The data collection method using the RGA10 mass spectrometer at Peking University involves sample preparation where white mica samples are first irradiated at the China Institute of Atomic Energy, and then tested with recorded Ar isotope signals measured in Mv units. Calibration includes periodic blank sample testing and data processing methods as described by Nomade et al. (2005). In contrast, the Argus VI mass spectrometer at China University of Geosciences (Wuhan) follows a similar sample preparation method but uses its specific testing and data processing procedures as outlined by Qiu et al. (2015) and Koppers (2002), respectively.
